hero.title: Don't ask the AI.
hero.subtitle: Ask collective knowledge.
hero.description: Every library is a collective memory – built from real voices, texts, and experiences. Choose a knowledge library, explore it, and start your conversation.

libraryGrid.title: Choose your knowledge library
libraryGrid.description: Each library contains structured content from talks, studies, or projects – and can be queried by you like a conversation partner.

howItWorks.title: How it works
howItWorks.subtitle: A simple process that makes real knowledge accessible

step1.title: Choose your library
step1.description: Decide which topic area you want to retrieve knowledge from.
step1.detail: Each library is based on real, verifiable sources.

step2.title: Ask your question
step2.description: Formulate your question in your own words.
step2.detail: The platform understands language, context, and role – like a journalist or researcher.

step3.title: Discover perspectives
step3.detail: Knowledge is not invented, but recombined and verifiably linked.

philosophy.title: Transparency instead of black box
philosophy.subtitle: Every answer is based on open data, verifiable sources, and people who share their knowledge. We believe that the future of knowledge is not generated, but shared.

transparent.title: Verifiable
transparent.description: All sources are transparent and verifiable

human.title: Human
human.description: Based on real voices and experiences

behindLibraries.title: Who stands behind the libraries?
behindLibraries.description: These libraries are maintained together with research institutions, NGOs, and open communities. Each can contribute their own topics, metadata, and values.

cta.title: A shared adventure project
cta.description1: Knowledge Scout is not a finished product, but an open laboratory – an adventure project in development.
cta.description2: We experiment with open technologies to find out how collective knowledge will be experienced in the future: through listening, reading, understanding, and shared reflection.
cta.description3: If this interests you, you are invited to think along, test, or contribute libraries yourself.

gallery.storyModeTooltip: Discover knowledge anew: Story Mode tells the talks from your perspective – in your language and with your focus.
gallery.referencesDescription: The answer was generated from these documents.
gallery.storyModeGalleryDescription: Answers are generated from the talks selected in the Gallery.

story.defaultHeadline: Story Mode – Understanding knowledge from SFSCon talks
story.defaultIntro: This overview was generated from all selected talks. It shows the central topics and opens the dialogue with knowledge. You can ask your own question or be guided along the topics.
